section.heading: Review of building permit applications; design and construction requirements.
section.text: The Mayor shall review all building permit applications for new construction or substantial improvements to determine whether proposed building sites will be reasonably safe from flooding. If a proposed building site is in a location that has flood hazard, the proposed new construction or substantial improvement (including prefabricated homes) must:

para.text: Be designed (or modified) and anchored to prevent flotation, collapse, or lateral movement of the structure;
Use construction materials and utility equipment that are resistant to flood damage; and
Use construction methods and practices that will minimize flood damage.

annotations.annotation: Delegation of authority pursuant to D.C. Law 1-64, the “D.C. Applications Insurance Implementation Act”, see Mayor’s Order 98-46, April 15, 1998 ( 45 DCR 2691).
